task.title: Restoring Configuration and Password
task.shortdesc: This section explains how to restore the factory default configuration settings, changing the routerâ€™s administration password to password and the IP address to 192.168.1.1. You can erase the current configuration and restore factory defaults.

taskbody.context: To restore the factory default configuration settings, use the Default Reset button on the rear panel of the router.

step.cmd: Use a sharp object like a pen or a paper clip to press and hold the default reset button for about 20 seconds (see page 1-3).
Release the reset button and wait for the router to reboot.
